Solicitation Title: Industry Day Announcement – OC-ALC Public-Private Partnership (PPP) Opportunity for F117 Engine Sustainment Support
Description Text:
The Oklahoma City Air Logistics Complex (OC-ALC), Tinker AFB, OK, will host an Industry Day to engage with private industry regarding potential Public-Private Partnership (PPP) opportunities in support of the F117 Engine Sustainment Support contract.

The event will feature briefings highlighting the missions, capabilities, and core competencies of the Propulsion Maintenance Group (PMXG), Commodities Maintenance Group (CMXG), and Maintenance Support Group (MXSG). These presentations will focus on how OC-ALC can collaborate with industry partners to enhance and strengthen sustainment operations within the F117 engine program.

To encourage broad industry participation, the briefings will be held off-base. Additionally, attendees will have the option to participate in an on-base tour of a PMXG maintenance facility, offering a firsthand look at OC-ALC’s expertise and operational capabilities.

Approximately 3–4 weeks after the in-person Industry Day, a follow-up virtual event will take place, featuring interactive breakout discussions for detailed engagement between government and industry representatives. This session will provide an opportunity for more in-depth dialogue, ensuring productive collaboration and knowledge exchange.

Date/Time: 25 June 2025, 9am-1pm (Time is tentative)
Briefing Location: TBD Off-Base Venue
Tour Location: Tinker AFB Building 3001 PMXG Facility
Virtual Q&A Session: Date to be announced following the in-person event

This event welcomes participation from all industry partners interested in exploring collaboration opportunities.

Agenda will be posted by 9 June 2025

Presentations and other pertinent information will be posted NLT 15 June 2025

To register to attend please email Chase Hebert at the OC-ALC Business Development Office at chase.hebert@us.af.mil. Please register by email NLT 30 May 2025 if you are attending the optional tour or NLT 18 June 2025 if only attending presentation and briefings.

This Industry Day is for informational and planning purposes only and does not constitute a solicitation or obligation by the Government.
NAICS Title: Other Aircraft Parts and Auxiliary Equipment Manufacturing
PSC Description: Maintenance, Repair and Rebuilding of Equipment: Engines, Turbines, and Components

Description Text:
** This is a 100% Small Business Set-Aside ** 

This requirement is for a firm-fixed price contract for two (2) each NSN: 5340-01-303-3614BA, Bracket Angle, Mounting-Accelerometer, P/N 17G230052-1, which includes one First Article and one production asset, one First Article Test Plan, one First Article Test Report, and one IUID Marking Plan. This requirement also includes three annual options containing a quantity of 3 each. The C-17 aircraft is powered by four (4) Pratt & Whitney F117-PW-100 high-bypass turbofan engines enclosed in isolated nacelles suspended below the wings. Part of the procedure for fault isolating the F11-PW-100 engine is to perform a vibration monitoring test while the engine, installed on the aircraft, is operated. Among the causes of excessive vibration is imbalance, bearing wear, and other types of mechanical deterioration. The vibration amplitude will be measured through the use of P/N 303-07C5 accelerometers mounted on the “B” and “P” flanges of the engine. The “B” flange is located near the front of the engine, on the fan case. The “P” flange is located near the back of the engine, on the engine turbine exhaust case. Am means is required at the organizational- and depot-level of maintenance to mount the accelerometer at the 12 o’clock position on the “B” engine flange. The means for the “P” flange will be documented separately. The mounting pad on the accelerometer has four (4) holes, 0.282” diameter, in a square pattern, 1.88” between adjacent holes. The hole spacing between bolts on the “B” flange is approximately 2.508”. The holes on the flanges will accommodate 0.250” diameter bolts. The means must be rigid enough to transmit the vibrations from the engine flange to the accelerometer without distorting the vibration signal. This will be a 100% Small Business Set-Aside. Offerors shall prepare their proposals in accordance with the mandatory, explicit, and detailed instructions contained in the RFQ. All responsible small business sources may submit a proposal to be considered by the contracting agency. The Government will utilize the Past Performance Information Retrieval System (PPIRS), Excluded Parties List System (EPLS), and other Government databases to determine contractor status before evaluating proposals. Proposals will be evaluated based on the criteria stated in the RFQ. All data for this weapon system is considered EXPORT CONTROLLED.

76 PMXG engineering request the purchase of the following item (s):
One (1) Twin Column ECL Workstation: Job No.12994
One (1) Twin Column ECL Workstation: Job No. 12994-1
Requirements:
- Two Column workstation to support, lift, and rotate F117 LPT and Fan case modules
- End tooling compatible with Pratt & Whitney fixtures PWA80712 & PWA83305/PWA83306
- 480 VAC Electric Power
- Minimum 80 psi for safety lock
- 2600 lbs overall Capacity at center of tooling fixture / Job No.12994
- 3000 lbs overall capacity at center of tooling fixture / Job No. 12994-1
- 180 degree powered rotation
- Adjustable lift/rotation speed
- Push button operated control with E-Stop feature

Solicitation Title: P22-004 F117 Ingersoll-RandTorque Wrench and Controller
Description Text:
The requested equipment item descriptions/specifications are outlined below:

a. Item Number 1 Qty. 1 ea. P/N QCD11 - Ingersoll-Rand Controller 

b. Item Number 2 Qty. 1 ea. - P/N QE6AT040PA4S06 - Ingersoll-Rand Torque Wrench 

c. Item Number 3 Qty. 1 ea. P/N GEA40-C0RD-6M 19 - Ingersoll-Rand foot power cord for Ingersoll Rand controller 

d. Item Number 4 Qty. 1 ea. - P/N ETIRQET441210YEDAA - E-Tech 5/16 flush socket attachment w/Quick change 

e. Item Number 5 Qty. 1 ea. - P/N ETIRQET41810YGAA - E-Tech 3/8 flush socket attachment w/Quick change 

f. Item Number 6 Qty. 1 ea. - P/N ETIRQET42013YHDAA - E-Tech 7/16 flush socket attachment w/Quick change

76 PMXG Request for the purchase and installation of one (1) F117 new oven for heating engine parts to include the following:


-	The oven shall be rated to at least 600 degrees Fahrenheit.
-	The internal dimensions shall be at least 36" x 36" x 36".
-	The power output shall be at least 13.5kW.
-	A blower motor/fan for the exhaust duct shall be required.
-	The preferred electrical input shall be 480VAC, but 208VAC is also acceptable.
-	The Contractor shall provide Installation.
-	The contractor shall provide Performance Verification.
-	Contractor must meet all requirements outlined in the Statement of Work (SOW).

Description Text:
The Air Force intends to solicit and award a firm fixed price, sole source purchase order to Pratt & Whitney, under the authority of FAR 13.106-1(b)(1), for the F117 Balance Workhorse Bearings for the Oklahoma City Air Logistics Complex (OC-ALC).



Contractor registration in the System for Award Management (SAM) is required prior to receiving any contracts or orders from the Government.  Contractors can register electronically at https://www.sam.gov/portal/public/SAM/.  The NAICS code for this requirement is 336413.



Interested persons may identify their interest and capability to respond to the requirement by submitting a quote and information.  Electronic procedures will be used for this solicitation through FedBizOps at https://www.fbo.gov/.  No telephone requests. Authority is 10 USC 2304(c)(1).
NAICS Title: Other Aircraft Parts and Auxiliary Equipment Manufacturing

Description Text: The Maintenance Contracting Branch, Air Force Sustainment Center, Tinker AFB, OK, intends to award a sole source purchase order to Pratt & Whitney Military Aftermarket Services, Inc. of East Hartford, CT for the correlation of Tinker AFB's F117 Test Cell. The authority for this award is 10 U.S.C. 2302b, Implementation of Simplified Acquisition Procedures, as found at AAFARS 5313.501.  Please contact Lily E. Wilkerson, Contract Specialist, for any questions or concerns.

Description Text:
This will be an 8(a) set-aside to TFAB Defense Systems, LLC firm fixed price acquisition for two (2) each Driver, Borescope Plug-F117 AP8.  This includes one (1) each First Article unit and one (2) each Production unit applicable to the C-17 aircraft.  NSN:  5120-01-419-1808, P/N:  17G230255-1, Destination:  EB2090 (US AIR FORCE PROPERTY CO BOEING).  This acquisition will also include three options with a quantity range of one to two (1-2) each. The approximate issue date will be 19 April 2019 with an approximate response date of 20 May 2019.  
This notification should contain Company Name, Address, Point of Contact, CAGE, Size of Business pursuant to North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) 336413. Interested persons may identify their interest and capability to respond to the requirement.  For assistance in interpreting the FBO announcements, please see the FBO Vendor's Guide.

North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code: 336413 (Other Aircraft Parts and Auxiliary Equipment Manufacturing)SBA Size Standard: 1,250 employeesRequirement Information: New Manufacture of Motor to support multiple weapon system (A010, F015, F016, F117).
This Sources Sought Synopsis (SSS) is in support of market research being conducted by the United States Air Force (USAF). This market research is being conducted to increase competition for this requirement by identifying potential sources and to gauge small business interest to determine whether or not this requirement can be satisfied with a Small Business Set-Aside.
The Government will use the information gathered through publication of this SSS to determine the best acquisition strategy for this requirement. The Government is interested in all potential sources including Small Businesses, Small Disadvantaged Businesses, 8(a) businesses, Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Businesses, HUBZone Small Businesses, Women-Owned Small Businesses, etc.
Potential sources shall be capable of furnishing all labor, materials, facilities and equipment required to accomplish the new manufacture of the item(s) listed below. Generally, this entails the procurement/manufacture of component parts, inspection, testing, preservation/packaging, and shipping. Additionally, potential sources may be responsible for supply chain management, logistics planning, forecasting production requirements, long-lead time parts procurement, diminishing manufacturing sources and material shortage issues, and shipping serviceable assets. The unit prices will be established at the time of a contract award for the item(s) listed below.
Potential sources may be responsible for nonrecurring engineering costs associated with becoming an approved source.
Estimated Solicitation Information:Estimated Solicitation Date: 1 Aug 2017Estimated Solicitation Closing/Response Date: 18 July 2017PR#: FD2030-18-00098
Item Information: Nomenclature/Noun: Motor, Alternating CNational Stock Number (NSN): 6105-00-315-1186HYPart Number (P/N): 9954CC361Application: Multiple weapon system (A010, F015, F016, F117)
Production Information:P/N NSN Noun Estimated Requirement9954CC361 6105-00-315-1186HY Actuator, Electro-Me YR 1 - 17ea
The work specified in this SSS does not have any associated technical data available for distribution. Potential sources for this effort shall be companies who have a current license or agreement with the SKURKA AEROSPACE INC.. to complete the work described in this SSS. Companies interested in performing the work specified, and have met the requirements stated above, should submit this information (i.e. license or agreement information) to the requirements workflow at the following address. Please include the PR number in the subject line of the request to ensure the action is routed to the responsible organization.
423SCMS.Requirements@us.af.mil
NOTE: Potential sources should only submit questions regarding this post to the above email address. DO NOT CONTACT THE ORIGINATOR OF THIS POST WITH QUESTIONS.
Disclaimer:This SSS is issued solely for informational and planning purposes. It does not constitute a solicitation (Request for Information, Request for Proposal, or Request for Quotation) or a promise to issue a solicitation in the future.
The information in this notice is based on current information as of the publication date. The information in this notice is subject to change and is not binding to the Government. If changes are made, updated information will be provided in future notices and will be posted on the Federal Business Opportunities website at www.fbo.gov.
